	Responsible for the efficient operation and maintenance of utility systems&mdash;power generation, water treatment, air compressors, boilers, HVAC, and related equipment&mdash;to ensure continuous and reliable support for plant operations in line with safety, quality, and environmental standards.

	Ensure compliance with HSE policies, operational procedures, and regulatory standards.
	Support optimization initiatives to improve energy efficiency and system reliability.
	Coordinate with maintenance and production teams to ensure seamless operations.

	5 years of relevant experience in utilities or plant operations within oil and gas or related industries.
	Good knowledge of boilers, compressors, generators, HVAC, and water treatment systems.
	Familiarity with plant automation/SCADA systems is an advantage.


&nbsp;Skills and Competencies:


	Strong technical and troubleshooting skills.
	Good understanding of safety and environmental standards.
	Analytical, detail-oriented, and reliable.
	Effective communication and teamwork abilities.
	Willingness to work shifts or extended hours when required.

Utilities / Plant Operations Officer Job at Amaiden Energy Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Amaiden Energy Nigeria Limited (formerly Moody International Nigeria Limited) was established in 1996 as a partnership between Moody International Group and Nigerian investors. Since commencing operations in March 1997 the company continues to grow and exerts its presence in numerous Projects in the Nigeria Oil and Gas Industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Utilities / Plant Operations Officer

Job Location: Bonny Island, Port Harcourt, Rivers
Job Nature: Standard

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Responsible for the efficient operation and maintenance of utility systems—power generation, water treatment, air compressors, boilers, HVAC, and related equipment—to ensure continuous and reliable support for plant operations in line with safety, quality, and environmental standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Operate and monitor all plant utility systems to maintain optimal performance and supply.
	Perform routine inspections, preventive maintenance, and minor repairs on utility equipment.
	Identify and report equipment faults, ensuring timely resolution to minimize downtime.
	Maintain accurate operation logs, maintenance records, and performance reports.
	Ensure compliance with HSE policies, operational procedures, and regulatory standards.
	Support optimization initiatives to improve energy efficiency and system reliability.
	Coordinate with maintenance and production teams to ensure seamless operations.


Qualifications and Experience


	B.Sc. or HND in Mechanical, Electrical, or Process Engineering.
	5 years of relevant experience in utilities or plant operations within oil and gas or related industries.
	Good knowledge of boilers, compressors, generators, HVAC, and water treatment systems.
	Familiarity with plant automation/SCADA systems is an advantage.


 Skills and Competencies:


	Strong technical and troubleshooting skills.
	Good understanding of safety and environmental standards.
	Analytical, detail-oriented, and reliable.
	Effective communication and teamwork abilities.
	Willingness to work shifts or extended hours when required.

title: Warehouse Assistant Job at Future Moves Recruitment Agency
content:
Future Moves Recruitment Agency is a licensed full-fledged Human Resource firm with extensive expertise and experience in human Capital development and staffing. Future Moves has exceptional expertise in Talent Sourcing, learning & development, talent management, HR Outsourcing & Payrolling, HR planning & Consulting, Policy Drafting, Culture Change and Organisation Effectiveness by designing and implementing interventions which identify the core areas of development to enhance the overall growth and competitiveness of your organization.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Assistant
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Satelite Town, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Working days: Monday - Saturday

About the Role


	The Warehouse Assistant is responsible for receiving, storing, organizing, and dispatching goods to ensure smooth warehouse operations and proper inventory management.


Key Responsibilities


	Receive, label, and arrange products in the warehouse.
	Pick, pack, and prepare goods for delivery.
	Keep the warehouse clean, organized, and safe.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE/WAEC.
	Smart, physically fit, and attentive to detail.
	Previous warehouse experience is an advantage.
	Preferably male for gender balance.
	Must live close to the location.


Salary
N70,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruiter.b@fmragency.com using “Warehouse Assistant” as the subject of the email.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Operations Manager",
  "description": "Owens and Xley Consults -&nbsp;Our client, a women&rsquo;s-only members club designed to nurture connection, wellness, and growth, is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	Our client, a women&rsquo;s-only members club designed to nurture connection, wellness, and growth, is seeking an Operations Manager to join their founding team.
